bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 81 (Thursday, May 17, 2018)][Pages H4209-H4210]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. VELAZQUEZ:H.R. 5862.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1[[Page H4210]]The Congress shall have Power to . . . provide for the . .. general Welfare of the United States, . . .

Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Inventor Diversity and Equality Act of 2018

This bill directs the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office to collect and publish demographic information (including gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, and income level) that is voluntarily submitted by inventors who apply for patents.

bill.title: Inventor Diversity and Equality Act of 2018

item.title: Inventor Diversity and Equality Act of 2018
To amend chapter 11 of title 35, United States Code, to require the voluntary collection of demographic information for patent applications, and for other purposes.
Inventor Diversity and Equality Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
